question: 5 (c)
statement_html:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

\[\begin{aligned} P = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\ \frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\ \frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\ 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\ 0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

(c) Introduce a damping factor of 1/2 so that the surfer now moves according to the stochastic matrix (1/2)P + (1/2)Q where Q is the stochastic matrix describing a surfer picking any site at random (including the current site). Beginning equal probabilities of being at each site, what are the probabilities of being at each site after one step?
